page.title: 09Education, Eaton B & Edlesbo
page.content: Eaton Bray's school is a lower school with 90 pupils aged 5-9 years and is part of Bedfordshire's 3-tier system. Pupils from the school go mostly to Middle Schools (9-13 years) and Upper School (13-18 years) in Dunstable. The dilapidated Victorian buildings and 'temporary' huts are a cause of concern in the village. It is hoped that a new school will be built soon as, after 20 years of trying, the school is now listed as a project on the county expenditure programme. The more modern Edlesborough school, with 225 pupils aged 5-12, is part of the Buckinghamshire system. Pupils go either to the Grammar School in Aylesbury or to the Secondary School in Wing. There is no nursery school, but there are 2 playgroups and occasional Adult Education classes in Edlesboro'.
